title: One step at a time (TEFC): introduction to behavior modification
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Psychology - Study and teaching
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Behavior modification
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Reinforcement (Psychology)
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Handicapped - Psychology
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Psychology - Study and teaching
description: Dr Roger Ulrich explains how positive reinforcement in behaviour modification works. He shows how praise, warm physical contact, tokens, charts and graphs, and other rewards encourage handicapped children or disturbed adults to respond with appropriate behaviour.
